description: reclining foreshortened figure, lying on PR side, with knees bent and feet drawn up; sketchy
inscription:
Stamp and label

old label, formerly affixed to frame: [60 ANDRIES BOTH 17TH C. HOLLAND FRAMED SEATED BOY, BLACK CRAYON AND WHITE ON BLUE PAPER, 102 x 131 MM.]
medium: Black and white chalk on blue paper
provenance: [Pietro Scarpa, Venice, until 1970; sold, May, as by Andries Both, for $160, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1970-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Seated Boy
